commit_message:
Implement get_extra_metadata

get_extra_metadata will be implementaed in nfs backup driver.
The modification will support backup import on the replication
destination side for disaster recovery purpose,
and generate a file that will import that metadata when needed

Change-Id: Ie272756e33e10ff1fa7110e8822bd9f264f0579c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/60/239460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================================== Implement get_extra_metadata ==================================================================== URL of launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/implement-get-extra-metadata * This backup service can use ProtecTIER's inline deduplication, in order to improve backup and recovery of volumes, lower operational costs and manage more data with less infrastructure. Problem description =================== * Currently backup of cinder volumes does not fully support ProtecTIER, therefore customers that want to maximize storage capacity while minimizing cost, can't import a backup on the replication destination side for disaster recovery purpose. * Combination of ProtecTIER native replication and this backup service will enable volume migration: ProtecTIER native replication employs bandwidth reduction based on PT deduplication. * ProtecTIER offers deduplication of data: It can identify duplicate data even if parts of this data have been shifted as a result of data insertion or movement. Offers global deduplication across the whole repository, so that similar data that appears in more than one volume, will be stored only once. A PT server should be configured on the destination site. PT GUI should be used to create a replication policy from source to destination for the directory used by PT backup driver. Native replication then copies the backed-up volumes to the destination. Use Cases ========= * When user wants to use ProtecTIER at the backend, replicate backup to destination site, and then restore it during disaster recovery scenario. Proposed change =============== * In order to support volume backup and replication to PT, we need to extend nfs backup driver: * Be able to save extra metadata, which enables a restore of backups at the replication destination site, for the disaster recovery purposes. * Create a simple python file that will parse that extra metadata from backup_metadata file, and will import that metadata when needed. The file will be stored next to backup_metadata file that is created during a volume backup, in the volume backup path. * Finally, user will be able to restore that backup on destination site, using cinder backup restore api. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ * Unless there is usage of backup services, new code will not be executed, therefore, no impact on performance without backup services. * The new code will be called every time there will be a backup,restore or delete of volume request, using ProtecTIER server. * Every backup service application (including ProtecTIER) needs to read data from user's volume on a backup request, and write it to destination path, and vice versa on restore, so it might have an impact on the performance. Other deployer impact --------------------- * Unless there is a usage of backup services, new code will not be executed, therefore, there will be no impact on deployer without backup services. * If user is going to use backup services, it requires one-time prerequisite configuration: 1. Configure ProtecTIER server. 2. Add the following configuration options to the [DEFAULT] section of the cinder.conf: backup_driver = cinder.backup.drivers.nfs backup_share = HOST:EXPORT_PATH backup_mount_options = MOUNT_OPTIONS Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ronen-mesonzhnik Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Implement get_extra_metadata that will return backup extra metadata, and will generate a file that imports that metadata when needed. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Unit tests of backup, restore and delete of volume, and get_extra_metadata. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== * Link to vendor documentation: http://www-03.ibm.com/systems/storage/tape/ts7650g/features.html

commit_message:
Adding multipath-tools package for nova hosts

This fix adds the multipath-tools package to all nova
nodes in order to support iscsi-multipath inside nova.

In order to enable this feature in nova the following override
needs to be configured:

nova_nova_conf_overrides:
  libvirt:
    iscsi_use_multipath: true

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1524957

Change-Id: I36da282043ce864c8a1fb69a1ee02e3a273c14e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/82/256082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - multipath-tools

commit_message:
Add a type restriction to bgpvpns when creating a router association.

Router associations should only be allowed with bgpvpns that have type L3.
This commit adds a check and will raise a BadRequest exception when the
bgpvpn is not of type L3.

Change-Id: I8b9da298a4e74ceddb764d84d86decb4499febe2
Closes-Bug: 1525863
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/80/257280/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not bgpvpn['type'] == constants.BGPVPN_L3: msg = ("Router associations require the bgpvpn to be of type %s" % constants.BGPVPN_L3) raise n_exc.BadRequest(resource='bgpvpn', msg=msg)

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.
Closes-Bug: #1525115

Change-Id: I271ab2581af08ffe0a345b0b795f8ae733e6cc0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/53/256153/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: passenv = http_proxy HTTP_PROXY https_proxy HTTPS_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXYimport_exceptions = testtools.matchers

commit_message:
Fix tunneling support for linuxbridge-agent

When I deploy linuxbridge-agent and enable tunneling,
the configuration of neutron isn't right. It lacks
the whole section [vxlan] to be properly configured.

Change-Id: Ib3bfe0f3445f466f4dbb36f7f0cb0d940114e7f6
Closes-Bug: #1481126
Related-Bug: #1524913
(cherry picked from commit c295bca61fbef22d4816b2db8cec40e924c709c4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/00/256000/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure vxlan tunneling if [[ "$ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS" == "True" ]]; then if [[ "$Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE" == "vxlan" ]]; then iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE vxlan enable_vxlan "True" iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE vxlan local_ip $TUNNEL_ENDPOINT_IP else iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE vxlan enable_vxlan "False" fi else iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE vxlan enable_vxlan "False" fi

commit_message:
Return wrapper classes with request_ids attribute

Added request_ids attribute to the response body so that the
resulting model has 'request_ids' as a property.

In case of list() api calls GeneratorWithMeta object will be returned
instead of generator object. Similarly  for cases where previously
None was returned now a TupleWithMeta object is returned.

Made provision to eliminate 'request_ids' from output shown to user.

This change is required to return 'request_id' from client to log
request_id mappings of cross projects.

Change-Id: I39fc47c25d028c6183fe673bff80df65deafbc7a
Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

commit_message:
Set a default timeout for 240 minutes for Heat Updates

This matches the behaviour in python-tripleoclient and helps us
avoid Heat timing out the update.

Change-Id: Iae80be66338f88b85b6df7a45055ea84cb5f47b0

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

commit_message:
Add Wrapper classes for tuple and generator

Added wrapper classes which are inherited from base data types tuple
and generator. Each of these wrapper classes contains a 'request_ids'
attribute which will be populated with a 'x-openstack-request_id'
received in a header from a response body.

This change is required to return 'request_id' from client to log
request_id mappings of cross projects.

Change-Id: If44e3f1bba2113ab26dd56fc95d2411aa78c97e2
Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/24/257324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_request_id(response): """Get request id from response header :param headers: Dictionary of response headers """ if not response.headers: return "" return response.headers.get('x-openstack-request-id', "") def set_request_id_for_model(body, response): """Set request id from response header to body. :param body: dictionary of response body :param headers: Dictionary of response headers """ body['request_ids'] = [] req_id = get_request_id(response) if req_id: body['request_ids'] = [req_id] class RequestIdMixin(object): def setup(self): self.request_ids = [] def append_request_ids(self, response): """Add request_ids as attribute to object Extracts request-id from response headers and add it request_ids list :param resp: Response object or list of Response objects """ resp_lst = response if not isinstance(response, list): resp_lst = [response] for resp in resp_lst: new_request_id = get_request_id(resp) if new_request_id not in self.request_ids: self.request_ids.append(new_request_id) class TupleWithMeta(tuple, RequestIdMixin): """Wrapper class for 'tuple' data type. Wrapper class for tuple data type with 'request_ids' attribute. """ def __new__ (cls, resp, resp_body): return super(TupleWithMeta, cls).__new__(cls, (resp, resp_body)) def __init__(self, resp, resp_body): self.setup() self.append_request_ids(resp) class GeneratorWithMeta(RequestIdMixin): def __init__(self, func, *args, **kwargs): self.setup() self._generator = func(*args, **kwargs) def __iter__(self): return self # Python 3 compatibility def __next__(self): return self.next() def next(self): model, response = self._generator.next() self.append_request_ids(response) return model def inject_request_id(func): def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): return GeneratorWithMeta(func, *args, **kwargs) return wrapper

subject: Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-06 15:14:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/utils/build_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/98b77f3389798dcdc4a7f3eaaf0fcf3452c24dea', 'message': "Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.
As a result a customized MOS package (which always resides in the `main'
section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64 Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/ mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by

packages.

(cherry picked from commit bf324e8f3981b050e89f710ab64411ef0d60ff04)

Closes-Bug: #1488844
Change-Id: I655b34bf0de80d26ba3f8c25fbb6b17bbaefc076
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.
As a result a customized MOS package (which always resides in the `main'
section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64 Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/ mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by
patched packages and/or break features which require customized
packages.

(cherry picked from commit bf324e8f3981b050e89f710ab64411ef0d60ff04)

Closes-Bug: #1488844
Change-Id: I655b34bf0de80d26ba3f8c25fbb6b17bbaefc076

commit_message:
Fixed connection_limit and added UT

Due to a typo, the REST API attribute of connection_limit was
not accessed when creating a new lbaas-V2 listener.
This patch fixes the typo, so that the connection_limit can
be initialized when listener is created. Also, the previous
code did not have UT for connection_limit when the listener
was created. The same has been added here.

Closes-Bug: #1515112

Change-Id: I71eef7b92de91edc1f3ce48f40c645bca704427d

commit_message:
Add the validation about Dependency-Permission

When we set the invalid permission about dependency files,
Storlets fails to handle the dependency.

For example, when we do not allow r+w by owner,
Storlets can never handle the dependency file,
after getting it to the local cache directory in swift nodes

This patch adds the validation process when uploading dependencies,
to prevent users from setting a wrong permission.

Change-Id: I2fbbdb5fb7177f4ff79eaab3d8c2fc0ff22ec6a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/69/256269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _validateStorletUpload(self, req): if (self.obj.find('-') < 0 or self.obj.find('.') < 0): return 'Storlet name is incorrect' def _validateDependencyUpload(self, req): perm = req.headers. \ get('X-Object-Meta-Storlet-Dependency-Permissions') if perm is not None: try: perm_int = int(perm) except ValueError: return 'Dependency permission is incorrect' if perm_int / 100 < 6: return 'the owner should have rw permission' def validateStorletUpload(self, req): if (self.container == self.sconf['storlet_container']): ret = self._validateStorletUpload(req) if (self.container == self.sconf['storlet_dependency']): ret = self._validateDependencyUpload(req) if ret: return ret
deleted_lines: def validateStorletUpload(self, req): if (self.container == self.sconf['storlet_container']): if (self.obj.find('-') < 0 or self.obj.find('.') < 0): return 'Storlet name is incorrect'

commit_message:
Add bifrost as an option projects in Service overview

There is a 'Service overview ' section in install guide[1]. At the end
of this section, it mentions about the option projects. We'd better
add bifrost[2] as an option here so that people can also use ansible
to play with ironic.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/install-guide.html
[2]https://github.com/openstack/bifrost

Change-Id: I2be14b00484c9cef4fb4862fa9514ed60522c1ad
Closes-bug: #1523754

Fix report for task deployment engine

Nodes now update own status: deploying, ready, error.
Progress bar now work again.
Final status of the cluster send after deployment

commit_message:
NetApp: E-Series fix JSONDecodeError on first add

The NetApp E-Series driver would throw a JSONDecodeError on the
addition of a new storage-system. This would occur because a
JSON response was expected, but text/html was being returned as
the Content-Type when a storage-system has been added but is still
coming online.

This patch adds a retry to the driver startup to wait for an array
to come online. It also adds code to avoid the JSONDecodeError
and fail based on the HTTP Response's return code.

Change-Id: I405723039c7a0df10d39bd2eb961ee64d71c2d01

commit_message:
Always use v3 nova/neutron authentication

There is no need to test here whether v2 is disabled or not. V3
Authentication will always be available and we should just use that.

Change-Id: I0d2d76ebdf261917f1a2b23c65f0f843ae50f49a

commit_message:
Spec for setting active l3 agent for a give HA router

Change-Id: Ie2671a493f6a9d505fb98aec5b6e4af4bc568a06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/73/201473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Allow admin to select active l3 agent for a HA router ==================================== Include the URL of your launchpad RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1370033 Introduction paragraph -- why are we doing this feature? A single paragraph of prose that **deployers, and developers, and operators** can understand. Do you even need to file a spec? Most features can be done by filing an RFE bug and moving on with life. In most cases, filing an RFE and documenting your design in the devref folder of neutron docs is sufficient. If the feature seems very large or contentious, then the drivers team may request a spec, or you can always file one if desired. Problem Description =================== A detailed description of the problem: * For a new feature this should be use cases. Ensure you are clear about the actors in each use case: End User vs Deployer * For a major reworking of something existing it would describe the problems in that feature that are being addressed. Note that the RFE filed for this feature will have a description already. This section is not meant to simply duplicate that; you can simply refer to that description if it is sufficient, and use this space to capture changes to the description based on bug comments or feedback on the spec. Proposed Change =============== How do you propose to solve this problem? This section is optional, and provides an area to discuss your high-level design at the same time as use cases, if desired. Note that by high-level, we mean the "view from orbit" rough cut at how things will happen. This section should 'scope' the effort from a feature standpoint: how is the 'neutron end-to-end system' going to look like after this change? What Neutron areas do you intend to touch and how do you intend to work on them? The list below is not meant to be a template to fill in, but rather a jumpstart on the sorts of areas to consider in your proposed change description. * Am I going to see new CLI commands? * How do you intend to support or affect aspects like: * Address Management, e.g. IPv6, DHCP * Routing, e.g. DVR/HA * Plugins, ML2 Drivers, e.g. OVS, LinuxBridge * Agents, e.g. metadata * High level services, e.g. *-aas. * Scheduling, quota, and policy management, e.g. admin vs user rights * API and extensions * Clients * Impact on services or out-of-tree plugins/drivers * What do you intend to not support in the initial release? You do not need to detail API or data model changes. Details at that level of granularity belong in the neutron devref docs. References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable.

commit_message:
Ironic: Support to install diskimage-builder from source

Prior to this patch devstack only supported installing diskimage-builder
directly from pip. This patch adds support to also install it from git.

This is needed so we can run tests on the diskimage-builder gate to test
against Ironic.

Change-Id: I43ae22dffa704b70f30a4fa7c4d22bc49d66c485

commit_message:
Implementation of router bgpvpn associations.

This commit implements bp router-bgpvpn-association. Router associations
will work similar to network associations except in the bagpipe driver where
the router association will in fact get translated into multiple network
assocations.

Change-Id: Ib1cde80dc22d067f38ab70adeea068ea476bb4c8
Implements: blueprint router-bgpvpn-association

commit_message:
Refresh patch file descriptor

Patch file descriptor has to be refreshed to position 0 after it was
read the first time into 'patch -R' command.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Abramov <sabramov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Iae8113f132ef27e3d42415d39e82ac2b9c24d4a9
(cherry picked from commit a5345f723e548e27acf2c78620f5e2400dce5caa)

commit_message:
Refactor YamlLoader

Use six urlopen to retrieve files, this patch will make codes and
unittests more simple.

Change-Id: I934c43a2507733a7f460e667ae070d550f0d18c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/39/257239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def normalise_file_path_to_url(self, path): if urllib.parse.urlparse(path).scheme: return path path = os.path.abspath(path) return urllib.parse.urljoin('file:', urllib.request.pathname2url(path)) try: url = self.normalise_file_path_to_url(self.construct_scalar(node)) tmpl = urllib.request.urlopen(url).read() return yaml.load(tmpl, Loader) except urllib.error.URLError as ex: raise IOError('Failed retrieving file %s: %s' % (url, six.text_type(ex)))
deleted_lines: import ioimport requests def __init__(self, stream): if isinstance(stream, io.IOBase): self._curdir = os.path.split(stream.name)[0] else: self._curdir = './' super(YamlLoader, self).__init__(stream) url = self.construct_scalar(node) components = urllib.parse.urlparse(url) if components.scheme == '': try: url = os.path.join(self._curdir, url) with open(url, 'r') as f: return yaml.load(f, Loader) except Exception as ex: raise Exception('Failed loading file %s: %s' % (url, six.text_type(ex))) try: resp = requests.get(url, stream=True) resp.raise_for_status() reader = resp.iter_content(chunk_size=1024) result = '' for chunk in reader: result += chunk return yaml.load(result, Loader) except Exception as ex: raise Exception('Failed retrieving file %s: %s' % (url, six.text_type(ex)))

commit_message:
Revise list field read/write

This is a fix to the read/write access to list fields. We need to make
sure we are not doing a lot of operations on such kind of fields. The
data type is not bug-free regarding concurrency.

Change-Id: Id49466fbd34e4d31603a933e551154c644571953

commit_message:
remove py26 support tag in setup.cfg

commit 32397cbd66bc7573e227cb49da1039f137c5f545 removed py26 from
tox.ini, so it's no longer test, we shouldn't claim support for it
in setup.cfg.

Change-Id: I7fbf6b9850914523de0ffb018626f310720c9845

commit_message:
Add new roles to create a router container and custom routes

Add a new role to create a router to pass inter-region traffic.
This change enables the replication bridge interface in the
swift configuration.

Additionally, a role is added to create custom routes, which
can be used to send traffic through the router node.

Change-Id: I4e38b52a25d878359535a0560eaf22fd1ed64056
Partially-Implements: blueprint multi-region-swift
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/83/203683/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack Router Server ######################## :tags: openstack, galera, cloud, ansible :category: \*nix contributor guidelines ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Filing Bugs ----------- Bugs should be filed on Launchpad, not GitHub: "https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible" When submitting a bug, or working on a bug, please ensure the following criteria are met: * The description clearly states or describes the original problem or root cause of the problem. * Include historical information on how the problem was identified. * Any relevant logs are included. * The provided information should be totally self-contained. External access to web services/sites should not be needed. * Steps to reproduce the problem if possible. Submitting Code --------------- Changes to the project should be submitted for review via the Gerrit tool, following the workflow documented at: "http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#development-workflow" Pull requests submitted through GitHub will be ignored and closed without regard. Extra ----- Tags: If it's a bug that needs fixing in a branch in addition to Master, add a '\<release\>-backport-potential' tag (eg ``juno-backport-potential``). There are predefined tags that will autocomplete. Status: Please leave this alone, it should be New till someone triages the issue. Importance: Should only be touched if it is a Blocker/Gating issue. If it is, please set to High, and only use Critical if you have found a bug that can take down whole infrastructures. Style guide ----------- When creating tasks and other roles for use in Ansible please create then using the YAML dictionary format. Example YAML dictionary format: .. code-block:: yaml - name: The name of the tasks module_name: thing1: "some-stuff" thing2: "some-other-stuff" tags: - some-tag - some-other-tag Example **NOT** in YAML dictionary format: .. code-block:: yaml - name: The name of the tasks module_name: thing1="some-stuff" thing2="some-other-stuff" tags: - some-tag - some-other-tag Usage of the ">" and "|" operators should be limited to Ansible conditionals and command modules such as the ansible ``shell`` module. Issues ------ When submitting an issue, or working on an issue please ensure the following criteria are met: * The description clearly states or describes the original problem or root cause of the problem. * Include historical information on how the problem was identified. * Any relevant logs are included. * If the issue is a bug that needs fixing in a branch other than Master, add the ‘backport potential’ tag TO THE ISSUE (not the PR). * The provided information should be totally self-contained. External access to web services/sites should not be needed. * If the issue is needed for a hotfix release, add the 'expedite' label. * Steps to reproduce the problem if possible.

commit_message:
Add lvm.conf cleanup to teardown script

This patch restores the latest backup of /etc/lvm/lvm.conf when the
teardown script is run.

Change-Id: I92ab7f59dd78536475b30286f754be708b84feb4
Closes-Bug: #1479870
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/27/217827/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Get most recent lvm.conf backup shell: > ls -1t /etc/lvm/lvm.conf.* | head -n 1 register: lvmconf failed_when: false - name: Restore previous lvm.conf shell: | cp "{{ item }}" /etc/lvm/lvm.conf with_items: lvmconf.stdout_lines failed_when: false when: lvmconf.stdout

subject: Add lvm-setup role and Cinder-specific lvm.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-28 13:03:28.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/lvm-setup/meta/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lvm-setup/LICENSE', 'playbooks/roles/lvm-setup/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/tasks/openstack_lvm_config.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/tasks/cinder_lvm_config.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lvm-setup/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/meta/main.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/lvm.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/lvm-setup/templates/lvm.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/20bb105040adbfb629c881a0d5a2bc5dbab7a95e', 'message': 'Add lvm-setup role and Cinder-specific lvm.conf

Currently os_cinder manages the file /etc/lvm/lvm.conf. When
cinder-volume is deployed on bare-metal this can cause a conflict with
the openstack_hosts role. Essentially there is no guarantee that any
LVM-related activies are due to Cinder.

A new role lvm-setup is added, this is used by both openstack_hosts and
os-cinder-install. This means that the same template is used to create
/etc/lvm/lvm.conf by the different playbooks and the projects use of
overrides means that any changes will be visable wherever the role is
used.

The os_cinder role is updated so that LVM backends use an lvm.conf file
that is located in /etc/cinder. The pv devices used to define the filter
in the conf file have been adjusted to only include those relevant to
Cinder.

Change-Id: Iba2f207bba2f354f32b5f7bf11929a481d1eb792
Closes-bug: 1488532
'}]
commit_message:
Add lvm-setup role and Cinder-specific lvm.conf

Currently os_cinder manages the file /etc/lvm/lvm.conf. When
cinder-volume is deployed on bare-metal this can cause a conflict with
the openstack_hosts role. Essentially there is no guarantee that any
LVM-related activies are due to Cinder.

A new role lvm-setup is added, this is used by both openstack_hosts and
os-cinder-install. This means that the same template is used to create
/etc/lvm/lvm.conf by the different playbooks and the projects use of
overrides means that any changes will be visable wherever the role is
used.

The os_cinder role is updated so that LVM backends use an lvm.conf file
that is located in /etc/cinder. The pv devices used to define the filter
in the conf file have been adjusted to only include those relevant to
Cinder.

Change-Id: Iba2f207bba2f354f32b5f7bf11929a481d1eb792
Closes-bug: 1488532

commit_message:
[WIP] add haproxy ssl termination for openstack public endpoint

This change add support to configure haproxy ssl termination for openstack
public endpoint.
 - nova-api
 - glance-api
 - heat
 - neutron
 - cinder
 - ceilometer

commit_message:
Add tox to upper-constraints.txt

While being so stable all this time, Tox broke on Tempest's tox.ini with
2.3.0 release. Since it's only installed using upper-constraints from
devstack, this is the only place we can avoid breakage.

For refrence, bug in tox: https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/294

Related-Bug: #1525352
Change-Id: I78f4d4050c6f7eaa1ee27ad3b840e3e94e68a9c1

commit_message:
statsd: fix flush() scheduling

Currently, flush() is scheduled only _once_. Indeed, loop.call_later()
is not "recursive", as it does not reschedule every flush_delay seconds
the call. It only does it once!
So let's build a closure that reschedule itself each time.

Change-Id: I2e16101890996a51cb2baa4ae7b21dd6d1e3c801
(cherry picked from commit 47c4d216b42df997becac229ccd91d0243a37252)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/69/255769/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _flush(): loop.call_later(conf.statsd.flush_delay, _flush) stats.flush() loop.call_later(conf.statsd.flush_delay, _flush)

commit_message:
Make keystone fully fledged SAML2 Service Provider

Allows the processing of SAML assertions by python code running in 
Keystone instead of depending on the Web server plugin.  Since
mod_mellon or mod_shib are configured per sub-url, adding a new Service
provider means restarting the Apache instances, which would kill all
current connections.  Performing this operation in Python allows dynamic
addition of services.

Change-Id: Ie9f42791238a3dc0c41c8168d2c476f1883eb30e
Implements: bp key-mgmt
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/94/244694/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Example Spec - The title of your blueprint ========================================== `bp key-mgmt <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/key-mgmt>`_ Problem Description =================== As of today, keystone works as a wsgi application deployed on top of recommended Apache HTTPD server. When it comes to federated authentication all protocol specific details are handled by the HTTPD. As an effect, all the configuration and keys required for ensuring proper security are located within HTTPD configuration scope and each change will usually requires root access to frontend server(s). SAML2 is among most popular and widely adopted federated protocols. By design, modules handling supporting SAML2 workflow query trusted Identity Providers every ``n`` seconds (default refresh rate is usually set to single hours) in order to refresh information about Identity Provider: * Identity Provider entityId * Identity Provider endpoints * Identity Provider public keys used for signing and/or encrypting of the assertions. Identity Provider administrator wishing to change a set of configuration should change metadata entry and wait for the data to propagate to all trusted Service Providers. Unfortunately the "update metadata/propagate changes" cycle is not sufficient when it comes to quick keys revocation. If the Identity Providers key has been compromised there is a chance that attacker will use it to access cloud provider (or any other Service Provider). There should be a robust and easy way for keys revocation to minimize risk after IdP has been compromised. This also means the changes should be executed immediately after the client's request, preferably by the client herself or the 1st level of support. Proposed Change =============== Implement whole SAML2 functionalities (both WebSSO and ECP) in keystone with barbican serving as a keys management service. Clients would upload their public keys to barbican on their own and revoke when appropriate. Keystone being a native, fully fledged SAML2 Service Provider would use barbican and stored keys for SAML signature validation and decryption. That way there would be no need to using Apache modules modules. Almost all configuration would be configured via dynamic API calls Alternatives ------------ Rely on today's design. If the IdP has been compromised and keys need to be revoked simply disable ``Idenity Provider`` and/or ``Protocol`` in keystone. That being said, a module handling the protocol (say ``mod_shib``) will let attacker get through, however keystone will raise appropriate HTTP status code (401 for disabled Identity Provider and 404 for deleted Identity Provider). After a configured period of time Apache HTTPD server will refresh IdP's metadata and update it's public keys, making compromised keys unusable. Depending on the SLA and other agreements with customers Apache modules should be configured to refresh trusted IdP's metadata within minutes instead of hours. Additionally an access to modifying identity provider and protocol objects configured in keystone should be granted to non admin users i.e. operators working as a 1st line of support. All required technicalities are implemented in today's versions of OpenStack. What is more, this scenario will atomatically handle all federated protocols as well align with recommendations for sharing configurations via exposed Metadata between trusted peers (main solution assumes clients would manually upload files to barbican) Security Impact --------------- There is a great security impact as software handling SAML2 protocol must be written with security in mind and new code should be carefully pentested. Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- Deployers wishing to configure federated capabilities in OpenStack would need to configure keystone as opposed to Apache modules according to today's design and recommendations. Performance Impact ------------------ Keystone would need to store all HTTP sessions as well as handle and evict them correctly Depending on the backend and whether caching is used, performance may be degraded in comparison to the one we have today with Apache modules used. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Developer Impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: marek-denis Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- * Add set of APIs and corresponding logic for persistent storage of trusted IdPs' metadata, except for the X509 public keys, as those will be stored in barbican and handled by the client. * Add a logic for querying barbican for corresponding IdP's keys * Add a logic for configuring Service Provider's entityId, clock skews, rehresh and check periods, timeouts handling etc. * Add capabilities for refreshing metadata information periodically (likely async task) * Add a logic for setting attributes map, as well as extend ``identity_provider`` APIs to configure those. * Add routes for handling ``<AuthRequest>`` and ``<AuthResponse>`` requests * Add a route exposing Service Provider Metadata * Add a logic for handling SAML2 HTTP sessions (storing, and evicting expired sessions) * Add a logic for interpreting and validating SAML2 assertions, including decrypting and checking signatures of assertions. * Integrate todays workflows with new added routes/logic * Add support for ECP extension * Ensure workflows for both SP initiated workflow as well as fo IdP initiated workflow (i.e. for K2K) Dependencies ============ We may want to depend on `pysaml2 <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pysaml2>`_ library or implement everything from scratch. Documentation Impact ==================== Document whole new configuration process, explaining that SAML2 can be now configured directly in keystone, whereas other protocols must be handled 'the old way'. References ========== * Example of the Identity Provider/Service Provider `metadata <https://idp.testshib.org/idp/shibboleth>`_

commit_message:
Build a Debian IPA image when DIB changes merge

In order to to speed CI build times for bifrost, we will
attempt to pre-build the IPA image when changes have been
committed to diskimage-builder, as the ironic-agent build
element is with-in the diskimage-builder repository.

Change-Id: If9363bff535f9d1fc9692767ac9194923030cfe7

commit_message:
Refresh patch file descriptor

Patch file descriptor has to be refreshed to position 0 after it was
read the first time into 'patch -R' command.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Abramov <sabramov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Iae8113f132ef27e3d42415d39e82ac2b9c24d4a9

commit_message:
Install puppet-timezone via puppet-modules element

Timezone module is embedded in overcloud images but not in CI.
This commit should fix CI failures in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249886/

Change-Id: Icf7c681f359e3e48b653ea4648db6a73b532d45e

commit_message:
Correct nova extension check before saving ports

There is no extension with name 'OSInterface' of nova
extensions, correct it to make sure to save external ports
infomation.

Change-Id: I7f5fdc53b56c809ab32f83b207cba582dc833d8f
Closes-Bug: #1515128

commit_message:
Improve public network detection algorithm

It is possible that there are several public networks exist.
ExistingNeutronNetwork used to pick first one of them.
Now when internal network name or ID supplied it tries
to find such public network that the internal network has
a common router with.

Change-Id: I252bb5545891903355cf7f8480a2cd76febcfebe
Closes-Bug: #1524322

commit_message:
Do not assign a value to the class variable 'widget'

Class variable 'widget' stores a default widget for CharField.
It is dangerous to change it. This patch fixes this and assigns
a value to instance variable.

Change-Id: I7220dcacd64aeee096e9340dc49bb4c5ebcfefd5
Closes-Bug: #1521535
(cherry picked from commit 88abc05d2401c1b3e163502923611c7d03c88d35)

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I6913f7f385a78218627c0538c2483cd2da2a2ecc

commit_message:
Remove eventlet WSGI functionality

This commit removes eventlet WSGI server and starts using
generic eventlet WSGI server from oslo.service library.
The change where the wsgi functionality was added to
oslo.service can be referenced here:
If8840168f10cc3561f4f01e6d456d6b4fd1de8b5.

DocImpact

Depends-on: If8840168f10cc3561f4f01e6d456d6b4fd1de8b5
Implements blueprint: reusing-wsgi-from-oslo.service
Closes-Bug: #1499658

Change-Id: Iea8af7b4a569fedc99e126524f18f98097c95a6d

commit_message:
Tidy up - Rename Base

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher
objects and components by every contributor.

This patchset add missing Base in class name

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: I95a3e41fbd5fcd90a99d81c9cf278940f50c7732

commit_message:
[Murano Docs] Add an intro to apps section

* Adds an introduction into the Managing
applications section of the End User guide.

Change-Id: I78bd93b50ccb960bd84fe94fc3db8b1415559ffe
(cherry picked from commit a5d38f65727ea9339af1ddc24ad3a17701f95bbc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/78/255978/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In murano, each application, as well as the form of application data entry, is defined by its package. The murano dashboard allows you to import and manage packages as well as search, filter, and add applications from catalog to environments. This section provides detailed instructions on how to import application packages into murano and then add applications to an environment and deploy it. This section also shows you how to find component details, application topology, and deployment logs.

commit_message:
Add neutron_ceilometer_enabled default

This patch adds a default for neutron_ceilometer_enabled as it is
missing from the defaults and causing playbook execution failures
when this variable is not set.

Change-Id: I00b432e3e0c6698bc47a05eeaaccddbcc378bfd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/86/254786/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable/Disable Ceilometer neutron_ceilometer_enabled: False # Fatal Deprecations

commit_message:
Implement a callback plugin for human readable ansible logs

This implements a callback plugin to make the ansible logs easier
to read. This is especially pertinent for the output of tasks
like shell commands and apt package actions.

It also disables the use of the verbose parameter for Ansible, as
this plugin outputs stdout/stderr anyway.

Change-Id: I56886ba1d7f99b861f625c68078583e82dae2988
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/00/254800/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This plugin makes the output easier to read wget -O plugins/callback_plugins/human_log.py https://gist.githubusercontent.com/cliffano/9868180/raw/f360f306b3c6d689734a6aa8773a00edf16a0054/human_log.py # Enable callback plugins

commit_message:
Use Ansible AIO playbook for run-aio-build.sh

The new Ansible AIO playbook requires Ansible to be installed *prior*
to running the AIO bootstrap script.

Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible

Change-Id: I28af8a587bde629fd0c81a6c4ba47dd64c2e44db

subject: Always pass keystone credentials to neutronclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 13:58:44.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/dhcp/neutron.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/dhcp/test_neutron.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/66cf3d00cbac0bb00aad46d64ec8629b4051fd7a', 'message': 'Always pass keystone credentials to neutronclient

If the token that is passed to the neutronclient has expired then the
neutronclient will attempt to re-authenticate, when this happens the
current implementation fails because it does not have the required
credentials, this patch changes the _build_client code to pass
the credentials and token to neutronclient and let it decide which to
use.

Change-Id: Icf426a269a41fc941cf95f9c7f279a468dad2400
Closes-Bug: #1524779
'}]
commit_message:
Always pass keystone credentials to neutronclient

If the token that is passed to the neutronclient has expired then the
neutronclient will attempt to re-authenticate, when this happens the
current implementation fails because it does not have the required
credentials, this patch changes the _build_client code to pass
the credentials and token to neutronclient and let it decide which to
use.

Change-Id: Icf426a269a41fc941cf95f9c7f279a468dad2400
Closes-Bug: #1524779

commit_message:
Removed H404, H405, H305 ignore in pep8

In the file tox.ini we have some pep8 rules disabled.
We should remove H404,H405,H305 from the ignore list.

Removed them from the ignore list, and got some errors.
I restructured the comments, and now with H404, H405, H305 enabled,
pep8 works without any failures.

Change-Id: Ic2aeb2a8bd47e92fbd2bb0f43fd00d44b6c220ca
Closes-Bug: #1523841

commit_message:
Not able to resume stacks in check status

Stacks, which are in check status are not able to
resume, since this status is not permitted.

This patch adding the check status in the
allowed status tuple to allow resume.

Change-Id: I378312d8a27b61f19da6444f4fee58a36ce05c66
Closes-Bug: #1506042

commit_message:
Check gateway IP is in given subnet range

In network create form, if we are giving the
gateway IP out of the subnet range, horizon
sending the value to neutron without validating.

This patch validating the gateway IP and showing
the appropriate error message.

Change-Id: Ic1d5cb44ce623f69d1df128fc6e256f103503298
Partial-Bug: #1471685

subject: [mocking-machinery] Add inject YAQL functions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 14:58:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/6eba0572ba4845fa4458387780e449a76cb40929', 'message': '[mocking-machinery] Add inject YAQL functions

Functions for injecting class methods or objects with mocks are added:
* mock can be provided as method name
* mock can be provided as YAQL expression

* Also, withOriginal function is added.

  withOriginal allows to use data from the original context in mock function.

commit_message:
[mocking-machinery] Add inject YAQL functions

Functions for injecting class methods or objects with mocks are added:
* mock can be provided as method name
* mock can be provided as YAQL expression

* Also, withOriginal function is added.

  withOriginal allows to use data from the original context in mock function.

Targets blueprint mock-context-manager

Depends-On: I9a55d07188ff06bdf98248f011a700c297e33417

Change-Id: Iefee767390209bfad0cca4f39389e0205cd3c9e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/90/252990/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from yaql.language import specs from yaql.language import yaqltypes from murano.dsl import constants from murano.dsl import dsl from murano.dsl import dsl_types from murano.dsl import helpers def create_root_context(self, runtime_version): root_context = super(MockContextManager, self).create_root_context( runtime_version) constext = root_context.create_child_context() constext.register_function(inject_method_with_str, name='inject') constext.register_function(inject_method_with_yaql_expr, name='inject') constext.register_function(with_original) return constext @specs.parameter('kwargs', yaqltypes.Lambda(with_context=True)) def with_original(context, **kwargs): new_context = context.create_child_context() original_context = context[constants.CTX_ORIGINAL_CONTEXT] for k, v in kwargs.iteritems(): new_context['$' + k] = v(original_context) return new_context @specs.parameter('target', dsl.OneOf(dsl.MuranoTypeName(), dsl_types.MuranoObject)) @specs.parameter('target_method', yaqltypes.String()) @specs.parameter('mock_object', dsl_types.MuranoObject) @specs.parameter('mock_name', yaqltypes.String()) def inject_method_with_str(context, target, target_method, mock_object, mock_name): ctx_manager = helpers.get_executor(context).context_manager current_class = helpers.get_type(context) mock_func = current_class.find_single_method(mock_name) if isinstance(target, dsl_types.MuranoClassReference): original_class = target.murano_class else: original_class = target.type original_function = original_class.find_single_method(target_method) result_fd = original_function.yaql_function_definition.clone() def payload_adapter(__context, __sender, *args, **kwargs): executor = helpers.get_executor(__context) return mock_func.invoke( executor, mock_object, args, kwargs, __context, True) result_fd.payload = payload_adapter existing_mocks = ctx_manager.class_mock_ctx.setdefault( original_class.name, []) existing_mocks.append(result_fd) @specs.parameter('target', dsl.OneOf(dsl.MuranoTypeName(), dsl_types.MuranoObject)) @specs.parameter('target_method', yaqltypes.String()) @specs.parameter('expr', yaqltypes.Lambda(with_context=True)) def inject_method_with_yaql_expr(context, target, target_method, expr): ctx_manager = helpers.get_executor(context).context_manager if isinstance(target, dsl_types.MuranoClassReference): original_class = target.murano_class else: original_class = target.type original_function = original_class.find_single_method(target_method) result_fd = original_function.yaql_function_definition.clone() def payload_adapter(__super, __context, __sender, *args, **kwargs): new_context = context.create_child_context() new_context[constants.CTX_ORIGINAL_CONTEXT] = __context return expr(new_context, __sender, *args, **kwargs) result_fd.payload = payload_adapter result_fd.insert_parameter('__super', yaqltypes.Super()) existing_mocks = ctx_manager.class_mock_ctx.setdefault( original_class.name, []) existing_mocks.append(result_fd)

commit_message:
Support assoc subresources with Kilo neutronclient

This change adds monkey-patching of neutronclient.v2_0.client.Client
to get the behavior added by change [1] and fixed by change [2] ; these
changes haven't been backported to python-neutronclient stable/kilo
branch.

This change also adds tests to check that the neutronclient
extension works as expected (from I01f192feadfce99d8eba8ba6701f0139ede985be).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202597
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235827

Change-Id: I5c8f89b1e0b7ca1f6dcad73527964dd5c7120151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/24/255924/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutronclient.v2_0 import client # bogus 'resource' name so that the methods dynamically # generated by CLient._extend_client_with_module won't # overwrite the one we create by monkey patching resource = 'network_association_BROKEN'# python-neutronclient Kilo does not have support for sub-resources # we thus do monkey patching as a workaround # We define the path to use here, since the one # in BGPVPNNetAssoc is made bogus NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH = '%s/%s/%%%%s' % (BGPVPN.resource_path, 'network_associations') print("monkey patching!") def _show_network_association(self, obj, parent_id, **_params): print(".show_ext(%s, %s, **_params)" % (NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, obj)) return self.show_ext(NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, obj, **_params) setattr(client.Client, "show_network_association", _show_network_association) def _delete_network_association(self, obj, parent_id, **_params): print(".delete_ext(%s, %s, **_params)" % (NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, obj)) return self.delete_ext(NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, obj, **_params) setattr(client.Client, "delete_network_association", _delete_network_association) def _list_network_associations(self, parent_id, **_params): print(".list_ext(%s, **_params)" % NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id) return self.list_ext(NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, **_params) setattr(client.Client, "list_network_associations", _list_network_associations) def _create_network_association(self, parent_id, body=None): print(".create_ext(%s, body)" % NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id) return self.create_ext(NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, body) setattr(client.Client, "create_network_association", _create_network_association) def _update_network_association(self, obj, parent_id, body=None): print(".update_ext(%s, %s, body)" % (NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, obj)) return self.update_ext(NET_ASSOC_RESOURCE_PATH % parent_id, obj, body) setattr(client.Client, "update_network_association", _update_network_association)
deleted_lines: resource = 'network_association' # (parent_resource set to True so that the # first %s in *_path will be replaced with parent_id) parent_resource = True

commit_message:
Skip gate FS optimization if no secondary disk

This commit removes the assumption that all gate nodes have a secondary
disk, and skip tuning the filesystem if the node doesn't have one.

This fixes gate failures on OVH nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1525047

Change-Id: Ief22f34b32caf7a8b446df888fc5cc1964ad272e

commit_message:
OSWL duplication in DB handled

We can have duplicated OSWLs. They have the same checksum but
different external_ids. Whe should ignore such 'new' OSWLs in the
report generation process.

Change-Id: I71b5ef91eb66a9ce475a78da2485f1ec439acd4e
Closes-Bug: #1524820

commit_message:
Remove deprecated neutron auth options

As a step towards using keystoneauth instead of keystoneclient, remove
the deprecated to-be-removed-in-mitaka neutron auth options so that we
don't have to translate the deprecated code paths to the new library
interface.

bp: keystoneclient-to-keystoneauth

Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3e3393d99533a70379822178983f73d5eef09bee

deleted_lines: class TestNeutronClientForAdminScenarios(test.NoDBTestCase): @mock.patch('keystoneclient.auth.identity.v2.Password.get_token') def _test_get_client_for_admin(self, auth_mock, use_id=False, admin_context=False): token_value = uuid.uuid4().hex auth_mock.return_value = token_value self.flags(auth_strategy=None, group='neutron') self.flags(url='http://anyhost/', group='neutron') self.flags(timeout=30, group='neutron') if use_id: self.flags(admin_tenant_id='admin_tenant_id', group='neutron') self.flags(admin_user_id='admin_user_id', group='neutron') if admin_context: my_context = context.get_admin_context() else: my_context = context.RequestContext('userid', 'my_tenantid', auth_token='token') # clean global neutronapi.reset_state() if admin_context: # Note that the context does not contain a token but is # an admin context which will force an elevation to admin # credentials. context_client = neutronapi.get_client(my_context) else: # Note that the context is not elevated, but the True is passed in # which will force an elevation to admin credentials even though # the context has an auth_token. context_client = neutronapi.get_client(my_context, True) admin_auth = neutronapi._ADMIN_AUTH self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.admin_auth_url, admin_auth.auth_url) self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.admin_password, admin_auth.password) if use_id: self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.admin_tenant_id, admin_auth.tenant_id) self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.admin_user_id, admin_auth.user_id) self.assertIsNone(admin_auth.tenant_name) self.assertIsNone(admin_auth.username) else: self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.admin_tenant_name, admin_auth.tenant_name) self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.admin_username, admin_auth.username) self.assertIsNone(admin_auth.tenant_id) self.assertIsNone(admin_auth.user_id) self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.timeout, neutronapi._SESSION.timeout) self.assertEqual(token_value, context_client.httpclient.auth.token) self.assertEqual(CONF.neutron.url, context_client.httpclient.auth.endpoint) def test_get_client_for_admin(self): self._test_get_client_for_admin() def test_get_client_for_admin_with_id(self): self._test_get_client_for_admin(use_id=True) def test_get_client_for_admin_context(self): self._test_get_client_for_admin(admin_context=True) def test_get_client_for_admin_context_with_id(self): self._test_get_client_for_admin(use_id=True, admin_context=True)

commit_message:
Add i18n trans tag for strings in template file

There are some strings in template files can not be translated.
Add 'trans' tags to be translated by i18n module.
The strings include 'Filter', 'All', 'Details', etc.

Closes-Bug: #1525113
Change-Id: I9042bd2b1291a8d542ae871a733587ae256e6263
Signed-off-by: stoneliu <hbjmstone@163.com>

commit_message:
Added unit tests on nova wrapper

As the coverage on the nova wrapper is actually very low, this
patchset is here to raise it a bit since it is a quite central
piece of code.

Change-Id: Ie7879c74c8d322d5031953827c339bb11d9085c1

commit_message:
Refactored Watcher codebase to add py34 support

Even though Watcher was mentioning python 3.4 as supported, it
really wasn't the case as all the unit tests were not passing in this
version of Python.

This patchset fixes all the failing tests in Python 3.4 while
keeping Watcher Python 2.7 compatible.

DocImpact
BugImpact
Change-Id: Ie74acc08ef0a2899349a4b419728c89e416a18cb

Change-Id: I6c6b956d970e4de9eedf69b96797fc9e64bc6b06

added_lines: An environment is a set of logically connected applications that are grouped together for an easy management. By default, each environment has a single network for all its applications, and the deployment of the environment is defined in a single heat stack. Applications in different environments are always independent from one another. An environment is a single unit of deployment. This means that you deploy not an application but an environment that contains one or multiple applications. Using OpenStack Dashboard you can easily perform such actions with an environment as creating, editing, reviewing, deploying, and others.
deleted_lines: This section is under development at the moment and will be available soon.

commit_message:
Fixed an incorrect call to the artifacts client

The artifacts client was called incorrectly in the "toggle public"
call routine, leading to an exception when changing the visibility of
package if using Glare.
This has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ic3da93bde00d96909cae106c358bf4a7d64d19a8
Closes-Bug: #1501374
(cherry picked from commit 9ee3790662c8356d6319d6212bc5b26cecaebb92)

commit_message:
Glare client now properly filters by class name

Adaptor class which wraps the legacy filtering requests into the
Glare-compatible ones has got a conversion for class_name ->
class_definitions attribute.
This fixes a bug when the engine could not properly fetch the package
by class name when deploying an app.

Change-Id: I98846bfad5fc03558dfc2e46fb4dcbfdb40489e8
Closes-bug: #1503224
(cherry picked from commit 4f2336fa382ed18cbdca89bf76eadb213551ada0)

commit_message:
Fixed a download method wrapper in glare adaptor

A method which downloads the package in PackageManagerAdapter class
now returns the full contents of the file instead of the iterator over
this contents.

Although less memory-efficient this is needed to ensure the
compatibility with the legacy murano-api-based package downloader.

Change-Id: I24183f14e70fc6d5a53850d2ac00d5d52fdc5559
Closes-bug: #1521139
(cherry picked from commit dce5e20f9c20ca5c23c72a672d2edd0480fff907)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 15:13:47.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/v1/artifact_packages.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient/commit/d125c2f75445fedb69f4fbcbec4ec4f6290644aa', 'message': "'to_dict' method added to PackageWrapper class

Change-Id: I2759ade3cfcbade27b459ba9b21b29e240f7696e
Closes-Bug: #1501405
(cherry picked from commit e5026fff1f958603fb9bf666590f1f2c2961c426)

commit_message:
'to_dict' method added to PackageWrapper class

PackageWrapper objects, returned by the glare wrapper of the murano
client did not contain the 'to_dict' method which is needed for
carousel.

Appropriate method has been added. It does not need to return the full
dict representation of the object: just id, name and owner_id have to
be returned, as these are the only fields used by the carousel.

Change-Id: I2759ade3cfcbade27b459ba9b21b29e240f7696e
Closes-Bug: #1501405
(cherry picked from commit e5026fff1f958603fb9bf666590f1f2c2961c426)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/64/256464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def to_dict(self): return {'id': self.id, 'name': self.name, 'owner_id': self.owner_id}

commit_message:
Get "cron trigger" list using model query.

If cron-trigger is created in different tenant
than workflow's tenant, associated cron-trigger
can not be got. So "model_query" has been used
instead of "secure_query".

Change-Id: Ief78f2cad76e6ca16893bff80c5e75c9015e9c74
Closes-bug: #1522286

Use latest CoreOS stable when building

This fetches the latest CoreOS stable version and builds the image using
that version.

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I64c83c96db5c00b04acca9a7538ab83b96fb5f9b

commit_message:
Set NeutronMetadataProxySharedSecret

This patch uses the standard password generation functionality to
randomly set the NeutronMetadataProxySharedSecret parameter.

Without this parameter, Neutron has a blank value for it's shared
secret. This value is used to to prevent spoofing, thus the
default value of "unset" is bad. This exposes a potential attack
vector.

Closes-Bug: #1516027
Change-Id: Ifb34b43fdedc55ad220df358c3ccc31e3c2e7c14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/57/254857/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameters['NeutronMetadataProxySharedSecret'] = ( passwords['NEUTRON_METADATA_PROXY_SHARED_SECRET'])

commit_message:
Apply offloading props to bond interface

Apply offloading properties for logical bonded interface.

Change-Id: I1570390a8cd3883cfb478be90f16fb75b90bb9ea
Closes-Bug: #1516990
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/97/249097/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Parse interface properties if @property_flush.has_key? :interface_properties debug("Parsing interface properties ...") ethtool_props = @property_flush[:interface_properties].fetch('ethtool', {}) ethtool_props.each do |section, pairs| debug("Setup '#{section}' by ethtool for '#{@resource[:bond]}'") optmaps = self.class.get_ethtool_name_commands_mapping[section] if optmaps pairs.each do |opt, setting| if optmaps.has_key? opt # Get number as is otherwise check true/false _value = case setting when true then 'on' when false then 'off' else setting end _cmd = [optmaps['__section_key_set__'], @resource[:bond], optmaps[opt], _value] begin ethtool_cmd(_cmd) rescue Exception => e warn("Non-fatal error: #{e.to_s}") end end end else warn("No mapping for ethtool section '#{section}' for '#{@resource[:bond]}'") end end end

commit_message:
Optimize the CLI of renaming a category.

The name of the category can't be non-ascii. When no-ascill
characters are used, the program can't find it's ID

Change-Id: I8a886f608b2fceb608898d335114fcde8edb108d
Closes-bug: #1525654

commit_message:
Add os-volume_attachments into the API docs

This takes the old info from the v2.0-ext guide and adds it into the
current v2.1 guide.

Change-Id: I2bf3a4e23220729bced7a5ca9a36df64bb7fcce7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/07/255207/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %common; %common_project; ]> The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud. The UUID for the server of interest to you. Volume attachment ID. A list of volume attachments associated with a server. A list of volume attachments associated with a server. Attaches a volume to the specified server. Preconditions You can attach a volume to a server with an ACTIVE, PAUSED, SHUTOFF, VERIFY_RESIZE, or SOFT_DELETED status. You can attach a volume to a server with a status that is not locked. You can attach a volume when its status is available. You can attach a volume when its volume type supports volume attaching. Asynchronous Postconditions After successfully attaching a volume to a server, the volume status changes to in-use. You can see the attached volume when you log in to the server. Troubleshooting If the volume status remains in available state, the request failed. Ensure that you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate the server and the volume status. ID of the volume to attach. Name of the device such as, /dev/vdb. Omit or set this parameter to null for auto-assignment, if supported. If you specify this parameter, the device must not exist in the guest operating system. A dictionary representation of a volume attachment. &commonFaults; &getFaults; &commonFaults; &getFaults; &postPutFaults; &inProgressFault; Lists the volume attachments for a specified server. &commonFaults; &getFaults; &commonFaults; &getFaults; &postPutFaults; &inProgressFault; Shows details for the specified volume attachment. Preconditions The specified volume must be attached to the server. &commonFaults; &getFaults; &commonFaults; &getFaults; &postPutFaults; &inProgressFault; Detaches the specified volume from a specified server. Preconditions The specified volume must be attached to the server. You can detach a volume when the server status is ACTIVE, PAUSED, SHUTOFF, VERIFY_RESIZE, or SOFT_DELETED. You can detach a volume when its status is in-use. You can detach a volume from a server with a status that is not locked. You cannot detach a root device volume. Asynchronous Postconditions After successfully detaching a volume, its status changes to available. The detached volume is no longer visible on the server. Troubleshooting If the volume status remains in available state, the request failed. Ensure that you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate whether another operation is running that causes a race condition. If you attempt to detach a root device volume, this operation returns the 403 HTTP Forbidden error code. &commonFaults; &getFaults; &postPutFaults; &inProgressFault;

commit_message:
Add oslo_config.Opt support in Ironic config generator

This patch adds oslo_config.Opt base class support in Ironic config
generator so as not to fail when 'auth_type' and 'auth_section' are
generated into [keystone_authtoken] section.

Change-Id: I8c3b95ac3b83154c007e6f77582e2d0f93418a1d
closes-bug: #1522841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/98/253498/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OPT = "Opt" OPT: 'none value',OPTION_REGEX = re.compile(r"(%s)" % "|".join([OPT, STROPT, BOOLOPT, INTOPT,

commit_message:
Updates to Gateway Device Management spec

Update API and DB models to support Tunnel IPs and
Remote MAC Table management.
Add tenant_id attribute to gateway_device API.

Change-Id: I28c3639fdc8499277c5b36cf299f147862541234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/31/251131/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VTEP Tunnel IPs and Remote MAC Table management is currenly supported for the 'router' type of gateway device only. Other VTEP configurations as well as VTEP device status are out of the scope of|tenant_id |string |CR |Yes |Tenant ID of gateway Device | | | | | |object owner | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+|type |string |CR |No |Type of the device: hw_vtep or ||resource_id |string |CR |No |Resource UUID or None (for type ||tunnel_ips |string |CRU |No |IP addresses on which gateway | | |(list of) | | |device originates or terminates | | |ip addrs) | | |tunnels. | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+ |remote_mac_table |list of |CRU |No |Mapping of MAC addresses to the | | |entries | | |tunnel IP addresses of the | | | | | |corresponding VTEP | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+Remote MAC Table entries are managed as sub-resource of the remote_mac_table. **RemoteMacTable** +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+ |Attribute |Type |CRUD |Required |Description | |Name | | | | | +===================+==========+======+=========+=================================+ |id |string |CR |generated|ID of the remote mac table | | |(UUID) | | | | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+ |mac_address |string |CRU |Yes |MAC address | | | | | | | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+ |vtep_address |string |CRU |Yes |VTEP Tunnel IP to be used to | | | | | |reach this MAC address | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+ |segmentation_id |int |CRU |Yes |VNI to be used to reach this | | | | | |MAC address | +-------------------+----------+------+---------+---------------------------------+ REST API Impact --------------- RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { 'gateway_devices': { 'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'primary_key': True}, 'name': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': '', 'validate': {'type:string': None}}, 'tenant_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'management_ip': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'management_port': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}' 'management_protocol': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}' 'type': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'is_visible': True, 'default': 'hw_vtep'}, 'resource_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None}' 'tunnel_ips': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, ‘remote_mac_table’: {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'is_visible': True}, }, } SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { 'remote_mac_entries': { 'parent': {'collection_name': 'gateway_devices', 'member_name': 'remote_mac_entries'}, 'vtep_address': { 'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None, 'validate': {'type:ip_address': None}}, 'mac_address': { 'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'validate': {'type:mac_address':None}}, 'segmentation_id': { 'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'is_visible': True, 'validate': {'type:non_negative': None}}, } } Sample request/response: Update Remote MAC Entry Request:: PUT commit_message:
Delete enabled argument from region

Region has an 'enabled' argument. But Identity V3 API doesn't
provide enabled attribute of region.
This patch deletes 'enabled' argument from region.

Change-Id: Id86c620d33408860d99bcf9c00f737870092c0fc
Closes-Bug: #1507838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/77/243377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create(self, id=None, description=None, parent_region=None, **kwargs): id=id, description=description, def update(self, region, description=None,
deleted_lines: * enabled: determines whether the endpoint appears in the catalog. Defaults to True def create(self, id=None, description=None, enabled=True, parent_region=None, **kwargs): :param enabled: determines whether the endpoint appears in the catalog. id=id, description=description, enabled=enabled, def update(self, region, description=None, enabled=None, :param enabled: determines whether the endpoint appears in the catalog. enabled=enabled,

commit_message:
Fix comment of create_keystone_accounts()

1) Group does not add user in create_keystone_accounts().
2) It's rather 'Project' than 'Tenant' in the comments.
This patch fixes comment of create_keystone_accounts().

Change-Id: Ibc0824fd9c13a91ff28c8b2edc1129d249a01478

commit_message:
Update development environment set up doc

Since install_venv.py and with_venv.sh under tools directory
were deleted, updated development environment set up doc to
use tox for building virtual environments.

Change-Id: Ie4c72ebc4dec2ae339a6028d1914142ee7ef3a4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/20/223020/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Installing Keystone and it's dependencies =========================================After installing dependencies, use 'python setup.py' to link Keystone into Python's site-packages.Once set up, you should be able to invoke Python and import the libraries. you should then be able to `import keystone` using Python without issue:
deleted_lines: - virtualenv_Installing dependencies =======================PyPi Packages and VirtualEnv ---------------------------- We recommend establishing a virtualenv to run Keystone within. virtualenv limits the Python environment to just what you're installing as dependencies, useful to keep a clean environment for working on Keystone. The tools directory in Keystone has a script already created to make this very simple: $ python tools/install_venv.py This will create a local virtual environment in the directory ``.venv``. Once created, you can activate this virtualenv for your current shell using: .. code-block:: bash $ source .venv/bin/activate The virtual environment can be disabled using the command: .. code-block:: bash $ deactivate You can also use ``tools\with_venv.sh`` to prefix commands so that they run within the virtual environment. For more information on virtual environments, see virtualenv_. .. _virtualenv: http://www.virtualenv.org/ If you want to run Keystone outside of a virtualenv, you can install the dependencies directly into your system from the requirements files: .. code-block:: bash # Install the dependencies for running keystone $ pip install -r requirements.txt # Install the dependencies for developing, testing, and running keystone $ pip install -r test-requirements.txt # Use 'python setup.py' to link Keystone into Python's site-packagesOnce set up, either directly or within a virtualenv, you should be able to invoke Python and import the libraries. If you're using a virtualenv, don't forget to activate it: .. code-block:: bash $ source .venv/bin/activate You should then be able to `import keystone` using Python without issue:

'Update volume API v1 and v2 to make these changes

- Spell-check and remove passive voice from api-site
- Renamed api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v1/api_samples
  and api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/api_samples
  to .../samples
- Renamed code samples using this naming convention:
  <resource>-<action>-request.json or <resource>-<action>-response.json.
  For example, volume-create-request.json and volume-create-response.json.
- Removed unused code samples
- Made method names consistent throughout - use list<resource> for list
  operations, show<resource> for show operations, and so on.
- Changed csapi:uuid -> csapi:UUID

Change-Id: I61f33e093c2ec882680d85e9cb3f7c450107496e
Partial-Bug: #1521244
'}]
commit_message:
Update volume API v1 and v2 to make these changes

- Spell-check and remove passive voice from api-site
- Renamed api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v1/api_samples
  and api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/api_samples
  to .../samples
- Renamed code samples using this naming convention:
  <resource>-<action>-request.json or <resource>-<action>-response.json.
  For example, volume-create-request.json and volume-create-response.json.
- Removed unused code samples
- Made method names consistent throughout - use list<resource> for list
  operations, show<resource> for show operations, and so on.
- Changed csapi:uuid -> csapi:UUID

Change-Id: I61f33e093c2ec882680d85e9cb3f7c450107496e
Partial-Bug: #1521244

commit_message:
/NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint cleanup

Add logic to search for port created by ipam and remove subnet creation
logic. Now subnets are created using IPv4Data and IPv6Data in
/NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork

Change-Id: I675bc7133b714cc18a7ee57a8431a8795fffe75e
Closes-Bug: #1521111

commit_message:
Implement /IpamDriver.ReleaseAddress

Implement /IpamDriver.ReleaseAddress and also add unit tests for
/IpamDriver.ReleasePool

Change-Id: I418370984eca0a8c60af7dae7d5dcd8132c0ee45
Partially-Implements: blueprint remote-ipam-driver
Closes-Bug: #1521100

faking list_subnets docker_network_id = hashlib.sha256( str(random.getrandbits(256))).hexdigest() docker_endpoint_id = hashlib.sha256( str(random.getrandbits(256))).hexdigest() neutron_network_id = docker_network_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) subnet_v4_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) fake_v4_subnet = self._get_fake_v4_subnet( docker_network_id, docker_endpoint_id, subnet_v4_id, subnetpool_id=fake_kuryr_subnetpool_id, cidr='10.0.0.0/16') fake_subnet_response = { 'subnets': [ fake_v4_subnet['subnet'] ] } self.mox.StubOutWithMock(app.neutron, 'list_subnets') app.neutron.list_subnets(cidr='10.0.0.0/16').AndReturn( fake_subnet_response) #faking list_ports and delete_port fake_neutron_port_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) fake_port = base.TestKuryrBase._get_fake_port( docker_endpoint_id, neutron_network_id, fake_neutron_port_id, subnet_v4_id, neutron_subnet_v4_address="10.0.0.5") port_request = { 'name': 'demo-port', 'admin_state_up': True, 'network_id': neutron_network_id, } rel_fixed_ips = port_request['fixed_ips'] = [] fixed_ip = {'subnet_id': subnet_v4_id} fixed_ip['ip_address'] = '10.0.0.5' rel_fixed_ips.append(fixed_ip) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(app.neutron, 'list_ports') list_port_response = {'ports': [fake_port['port']]} app.neutron.list_ports(fixed_ips=rel_fixed_ips).AndReturn( list_port_response) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(app.neutron, 'delete_port') app.neutron.delete_port(fake_port['port']['id']).AndReturn({}) # Apply mocks self.mox.ReplayAll() fake_request = { 'PoolID': fake_kuryr_subnetpool_id, 'Address': '10.0.0.5/16' } respnse = self.ipam_app.post('/IpamDriver.ReleaseAddress', content_type='application/json', data=jsonutils.dumps(fake_request)) self.assertEqual(200, respnse.status_code)

commit_message:
Add _show_resource to EncryptedVolumeType

Currently cinder doesn't support to_dict
method for it's resources, so we should add
override _show_resource method for
Cinder::EncryptedVolumeType.

Change-Id: Id9cd115f7029864b9af241eb00c086e9b9f5dd22
Closes-bug: #1520473
(cherry picked from commit 5799a0fcde257ccafa5e6dd4554ee79f6a6e85c5)
